paragraphs.text:
Flaws--
Too many to count
Too difficult to name.
Thank you Tre!

paragraphs.name: 6d9d
paragraphs.text: I agree with Dewi — that is sharp. Powerful. And, all the while, beautiful. Thanks for sharing this, Tre.

paragraphs.name: 524f
paragraphs.text: I agree. Was just writing a similar piece yesterday. Then stopped. I liked it. And I have to ask. Where do you find your pictures ? I need sources where I can find people similar to at least my family members. Lol

paragraphs.name: 2bea
paragraphs.text:
Human is the creature
Who does not remember
There was a time when
"Outside" was "Outside"
And not some digital image
Concocted on a canvas made
Of lies.

It yearns for sustenance
Buried deep in
Soiled forests but
Will not take the time
To harvest. 
Woe to the
Creature who is looking
For approval in
Sweaty bed linen
And overpriced vehicles,
She will become her shadow.
paragraphs.name: 452f
a2cf
paragraphs.text: You held up a mirror and named me. WHAT. These lines, especially… Fuck Tré. ❤

You’ve laid down the truth. It hurts. Every truth hurts. We know what we are doing but every time I read something like this, the pain aggravates. Yet, I wonder when will the pain be enough to make me rethink what I am doing. What we are doing as a species.
paragraphs.name: 64d8
25bf
paragraphs.text:
Gifted tongues ululate
At crescent moons, surely
Their voices will be heard.

74247214336a.title: Here, you weave sentences to create a path to acceptance; to reflect upon change, to steer the…

paragraphs.text: Here, you weave sentences to create a path to acceptance; to reflect upon change, to steer the reader to imagine things that can be different, while paying homage to that which is gifted by powers that reign supreme to mere mortals.
